pronounciation.overview:
The pronunciation is the part of the language the most teachers will you recommend to start with. The easiest and best-working way for that is to ask a teacher if he would go through the alphabet with you in voice chat and practice the different letters with you. But off course there are also resources which allow you to learn it on your own, for example:

 - Pamìrìks YouTube video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=e5JKGL-o16M
- Tirea Aeans Guide: http://tirea.learnnavi.org/index.php?p=sounds

lt.overview:
-l and -t are the two case endings which allow you to write simple sentences with transitive verbs:
__**-l** - Who does something?__
- consonant, ay/ey/aw/ew or rr/ll: -ìl
- vowel: -l
__**-t** - Who is affected by this action?__
- consonant or rr/l or aw/ew: -it/-ti
- vowel: -t(i)
- ay/ey: -t

This clear marking of subject and object allows us to write sentences in any order:
*Oel ngati kame.* = *Ngati kame oel.* = *Kame ngati oel.* = ... = I see you.

*If you want more infos about transitive and intransitive verbs, please use `%transitivity`.*
